#TidyTuesday Week 2020/31 üêß Palmer Penguins

Back to basics. Saw these fancy boxplots in @Tableau and here is the #ggplot2 version. Also, since people kept mentioning raincloud plots as an alternative to my ggplot evol jitter plot, here you go!

#r4ds #rstats #tidyverse #dataviz https://t.co/A094W6vK9I

Interested in learning #rstats in the context of #OpenResearch and #Reproducibility? I‚Äôm happy to share 10 workshops I've written for R learners with lots of videos taking you through things step-by-step.  1/2

So far I haven't contributed to #TidyTuesday, but @allison_horst's Palmer Penguin dataset is just perfect to showcase the pet project I am working on: #corrmorant, an #Rstats package for flexible correlation matrices based on #ggplot2. https://t.co/hXOqV5NsgV

Sometimes I need a little point-and-click GIS functionality in my #rstats work - which is why the {mapedit} package is so great.  Select features & create new ones that can be plugged right into your #rspatial workflows https://t.co/DuhspmF9oc https://t.co/BgHegoNId6
Create a publication-ready correlation matrix, with significance levels, in R  {https://t.co/ZZ5xrQmZRD} #rstats #DataScience

New: fixest() by @lrberge! Estimates OLS & GLM with (many) fixed effects, clustered SEs, event study-style analyses . . . AND . . . unlike felm() AFAIK, has a predict function! Could be useful for many political scientists who use DiD techniques. https://t.co/C0Oas10pAO #rstats
